methane.Sources: Production-stage methane emissions for natural gas use in each state, normalized by consumption, are from Burns & Grubert (2021). Other segment estimates are from a national bottom-up assessment of methane emissions in the U.S. from Alvarez et al. (2018)

scroll_chiller.References: Typical refrigerant, low-GWP refrigerant, typical annual leakage, and EOL leakage: Hwang, 2016 (https://iifiir.org/en/fridoc/harmonization-of-life-cycle-climate-performance-methodology-139940); Phase-out year: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, 2016 (https://www.epa.gov/sites/default/files/2016-12/documents/snap_action_scr2_factsheet.pdf); Typical charge: International Panel for Climate Change - Chapter 7, 2006 (https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2006gl/pdf/3_Volume3/V3_7_Ch7_ODS_Substitutes.pdf)

Centralized refrigeration.References: Typical refrigerant, low-GWP refrigerant, typical annual leakage, and EOL leakage: Hwang, 2016 (https://iifiir.org/en/fridoc/harmonization-of-life-cycle-climate-performance-methodology-139940); Phase-out year: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, 2016 (https://www.epa.gov/sites/default/files/2016-12/documents/snap_action_scr2_factsheet.pdf); Typical capacity: compressor racks + condensors - EIA 2018 (https://www.eia.gov/analysis/studies/buildings/equipcosts/pdf/full.pdf); Typical charge: Medium Centralized System - Galagher, 2014 (https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/es403447v); Typical Annual Leak Rate: Wan, 2021 (https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0140700721002632)
